Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: trixietrav
Reviews.Content: Great location and a wonderful suite. We were a family of 5 with teen and adult children so having two deluxe bathrooms (fantastic towels!) was great. The master bedroom bed was quite comfortable, not so much for the sofa bed though. Strong wi-fi signal in our room and very welcoming /helpful staff. We did get the hard sell from three different staff members to take advantage of the "complimentary" boat trip across the lagoon to watch glass blowing. Having been given a heads up on this, we were aware that this 'free trip' was designed to SELL SELL SELL glass objects.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Maga48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived on October 3-6 and had just finished a fabulous cruise. We have stayed in Bauer Hotel and Regina/Europa Hotels before so we thought why not try something that we thought would be comparable. NO WAY. The staff doesn't communicate with one another. We asked on 2 different occasions for a wake up call and both times we never received. There wasn't a clock in the room for us to set either. This is a maze hotel. They have 3 different reception desks that aren't always manned at three different locations??? We walked in the original one that is by their restaurant and had to walk across the alley way to another door that we had to take the elevator up 1 flight and exit to then walk down 3 flights of stairs into another reception area (sometimes manned) to then be lead to the 3 different directions to the 3rd building (reception is never manned) and walk up 1 flight to our room. They didn't give any instructions as to the functions of the room. If you do not leave the keycard (some had heavy keyrings others had church keys) in the wall everything in the room is turned off AND it takes about 10 minutes to get the water to run after that. The security safe always locks but sometimes doesn't unlock. I have the code memorized how they unlock it...doesn't make a person feel real safe about their possessions. The staff said one thing but didn't deliver on promises. They'd say we'll have a porter take your bags down and that never happened. So we had to take down ourselves. That's not right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Philiprundle
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this hotel was very disappointing - I guess I should have realized when they claimed I had booked at van 80% discount to the usual rate - what a load of rubbish! it was worth no more than what we paid. In short great location, reasonable rooms but the service was non existent - the in room phone did not even connect to reception. To summarize, we saw much better hotels in the same vicinity for around the same price. Won't be back - all because of staff - isnt that what hospitality is supposed to be about?

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: JenA_11
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, not noisy but close to the San Marco Square. The room was large - it was a deluxe suite. Separate bedroom for us, with a rollaway and a bed/lounge both in the lounge area with still plenty of space. We did have a few airconditioners outside our bedroom window though, and you could hear the room next door so I slept with ear plugs in. I had requested the room with the terrace but was told this was given to another client. The staff were not very friendly nor helpful. However the manager was quite welcoming. There is a small canal outside the hotel and gondolas do pull up there however water taxi's do not fit its too narrow.

Reviews.Title: “Was a great location for 1 night in Venice”
Reviews.Author: helloeverybody
Reviews.Content: We were travelling through Italy with our 2 children and spent 1 night in Venice. We parked in the Parkhouse and then took a ferry to San marco. The hotel was only a short walk away. The room was big and very italian but all we needed was there. We also had a balcony which was a bonus. We left our things and headed for the shops. We did a Gondel ride which was expensive but worth it â‚¬100,00. Back in the hotel we were happy it had airconditioning. The next day we checked out and were told they had a complementry trip to Murano. We left our bags in the hotel and went in a priviate taxi to a massive glass shop. it was really interesting and we were glad we went.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off place.. snappy on the phone”
Reviews.Author: Equitecnoc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not helpful when making booking changings. They charged the first night, regardless if the booking had to be postponed to an other date. Seems to me, they want the money and no service. Eventually we canceled the booking an they got snappy on the phone and hung up.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, spacious, wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: MiddleburyCT
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fabulous for a trip with late teen, early 20s children. Three room suite in a fabulous location. Beautiful rooms with unforgettable views of the canal and Venice rooftops. The bathroom was dated but completely functional. We would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Left a bad taste in the mouth...”
Reviews.Author: Italomaniac
Reviews.Content: The hotel accommodation is okay, although probably in need of a refurb. Reception staff were overzealous in pushing a trip to Murano - they did this at least 3 times. My criticism with the hotel hinges on the disappearance of my gold bracelet. Yes, I forget it, and a necklace, when we were leaving. So I was hugely reassured to hear the Hotel had it and had put it in their safe. Provided I organized a courier, they would send it back to me. Well, the courier was duly appointed, and appeared with a sealed envelope containing... the necklace - which has no commercial value. There followed a mutual blame fest between the hotel and the courier. The hotel handed a sealed envelope over to the courier. While they stipulate the bracelet was in it, clearly, nobody would be any the wiser. Only the person who filled the envelope was in a position to know what he put in it - or did not put in it. I can't help feeling that someone knows all too well how to play the system.

Reviews.Title: “great location and great room but don't go a boat trip”
Reviews.Author: ayamuzyka
Reviews.Content: Hotel locates in just behind of St.Marco Palace, although we lost a way. But it's great location. However hotel staff told us that there is a boat trip to Murano island where famous for Venezian glass. My mum and I were interested in about beautiful Venezian glass so we joined in this tour. (It's free) We expected that we could see around Murano island but they only took us one factory and factory staff's atmosphere was force to buy very expensive glass.

Reviews.Title: “Suites are excellent option for families with children”
Reviews.Author: BostonQT
Reviews.Content: The location just behind Piazza San Marco is unbeatable. We had booked a 2-BR suite for 5 nights through the hotel website, but were given a 1-BR suite through hotel error. Although we had to spend a night in the 1-BR, the receptionist was extremely helpful in correcting the error and moving us to a lovely sunny 2-BR with terrace for the remainder of our stay. We had a great view of the city and the small canal and bridge below us. The suite was roomy for our family of 5, and the lounge room had a large dining area with a small kitchenette alcove which came in handy for the couple of nights when our children were too exhausted to head back out for dinner. We were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but could use some sprucing”
Reviews.Author: janavratil
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location. Our room was large and had a great view of the city roof tops, the basilica, top of the clock tower, and even the bell tower. The room had visible damage (major scuffs on the wall, dents, some window blinds didn't open) and a very out-dated bathroom. The AC was a life-saver. If they fixed up the room and updated the bathroom, it would be more deserving of a 4 star rating. Next time, I'll probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Experience”
Reviews.Author: GLOBALINDIANS
Reviews.Content: Venice the most romantic city in the world.The trip was made most memorable due to the excellent stay we had at these suites.The palatial apartment done up in Venetian style and the deliciously cool a/c was fantastic.Located in St.Mark's Square the most happening place in Venice Island.The beautiful Cathedral and Bell Tower just a stone's throw away.The Balcony in the hall gives a good view.Lots of eating places and Designer shops just a few minutes away.Staff very friendly and helpful.Breakfast very filling with all varieties.We will surely come back to this hotel again and happily recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: JustATourist13
Reviews.Content: Manager was friendly, however, the same could NOT be said about the other staff. Arrived when san marco square was flooded, so had to walk through knee deep water with 20kg suitcases on our shoulders, no help with the door, no greeting whatsoever, no help with our bags (when clearly we were having trouble). Called reception to see how and where to get food/water, reception replied "there is NO food available at this time" - this was at 10pm - I find this hard to believe! Staff was rude and not accomodating. For example, needed to print some air tickets, reception sent us away to another adjacent hotel (when clearly they had a printer right in front of them!). This other hotel only accepted your credit card and an expensive fee to just use the computer printer (which in turn didn't even have microsoft word that was needed to print our document!). To use the internet (wireless), not only did you have to go to another floor, but there were no powerpoints!!!! Also, beware of accepting the "free" boat trip to San Murano Island. Only takes you to the Murano glass factory, where their main aim is to coax you into buying very expensive glassware - and makes you wait a very long time for your watertaxi back, in which they drop you off at a totally different area (i.e. 15 minute walk back to hotel!!). All in all, would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, centrally located apartment.”
Reviews.Author: TartanladRetford
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family of 5, and decided to use the San Marco Palace Suites. We were a but reluctant to pay the full amount up front and worried that we may have done the wrong thing! It turned out to be a fantastic and economical, way of visiting one of the world's beautiful cities. The apartment was just behind St. Marks Square, follow directions from Cafe Quadri. We had a spacious apartment which had 2 bedrooms and a large lounge/kitchen area with a sofa bed. Kitchen not very well equiped but if you need anything, just ask, it will be brought to you. Breakfast was a bit chaotic, you really need to be there early, as the dining room also services the hotel, therefore there is a high demand for tables. Breakfast was good value for money. If you have a family, these apartments are ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dofrUK
Reviews.Content: Three steps from st.Marco square this lovely hotel. Clean,right price and a nice concierge (sandro). Thank you for our special staying.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: HappyCanadaTravelers
Reviews.Content: We were a total of three adults and needed more space than one room but did not want the expense of two rooms. Our suite turned out to be an excellent option- significantly less expensive than two rooms at a comparable location, and plenty of space for the three of us. The location is excellent- just off San Marco Square yet very quiet. Staff was friendly and helpful enough. Room was clean and hotel website photos are an accurate representation of what to to expect. We had a very nice terrace off our room. It seemed that some suites may be nicer than others in terms of view and size- so ask for what you want.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bmccullo
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my daughter. Good points: nice location and good breakfast. Negative points: room extremely small (suites?), very high price of $268.00 per night, wi-fi not in room - had to go into hallway area to connect, and indifferent staff. My wallet (credit cards and cash) stolen the night before we were to leave. I needed money for the waterbus to the airport in the morning, but the hotel refused to charge the additional 26 Euros on my credit card or cash a check. They did not act surprised I had been pick-pocketed or offered any suggestions to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HrHartsell
Reviews.Content: We weren't originally booked at this hotel, but were upgraded here because of our two small children (age 4 and 18 months), maybe a perk of traveling with kids, I don't know, but it worked out well for us. The suite only had a king size bed and a daybed/couch, so that wasn't the greatest for a family of four, but we made it work....me and the kids on the bed, the hubby on the couch. It was air conditioned, which was great because Venice is HOT in July. They don't allow blowdryers or irons, because of the fire hazard, but there is a built-in blowdryer in the bathroom, which was a good size. The hotel is located behind St. Mark's Square, behind Cafe Quadri, so we were literally a minute from the Square. The room key has a huge tassel attached to it, so you turn your key in at the reception desk every morning when you go out and just get it from them when you return. Breakfast buffet was included with the room, served from 7:30 until 10:30 - breads, meats, cheeses, cereal, some hot foods (bacon and eggs), yogurt, fruit. Babysitting was also available from the hotel, you just have to request it a few days in advance to see if someone would be available. The young lady that watched our two boys was one of the receptionists we had seen earlier in the week. Price for the sitter was 25 euro an hour. There are restaurants and shops all along the street...we ate at Happy Pizza quite a bit (calzonnes, pizza, etc. - things the kids enjoyed eating). Gelato (icecream) was eaten alot by my 4 year old. Some places had a 2 scoop minimum for 2 euro, other places it was 1.50 euro for one scoop, but good and refreshing no matter what. We didn't take a stroller for our 18 month old and wished we had. The hubby wore a backpack carrier the entire week which worked, but made it extra hot and sometimes uncomfortable for both him and our son. All the websites I had visited about going to Venice with kids said don't take strollers because of all the stairs and bridges, but there were strollers all over the place...some bridges even had ramps over part of the stairs. If we had seen a stroller for sale somewhere, we would have bought it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BandBs
Reviews.Content: Can't beat this location--1 min. walk to St. Mark's Plaza--but shielded from the worst of the tourist traffic and noise from the Plaza. Be aware you do have to drag your suitcase across the Plaza from the dock--although you can hire someone to help. Staff was helpful, and breakfast was great. Accommodation was very spacious, and it's air-conditioned (not always the case in Venice). Venice is unbelievable and a must see, but don't expect to do this city on the cheap. You can help your budget by not eating anywhere near the Plaza itself. We found some great cafes about 5 minutes walk away. Check the menus and try to avoid the tourist areas. If Italians eat there, the food is probably going to be authentic and good. Be prepared to walk everywhere. There are no cars or truck in the historic area. Everything is delivered by boat. There is virtually no handicapped access and there are lots of steps to take up and down the bridges across the canals.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: kathih
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located just behind Saint Mark's square. Great location for sight seeing and shopping. Followed earlier review to locate hotel - very easy to find with directions given by other review. Just enter the square - turn after shop 119 - go over the small bridge and make a quick right. Great spacious room. Only complaint was shower and water... no temperature control on the shower - went from burning hot to freezing cold without touching anything! Staff was very helpful and friendly. Pushed 'free trip' to Murano glass factory - we did the trip but it was mostly a sales pitch. It was interesting to see the behind the scenes of glass making though. Those with early flights out of Venice - it is very expensive to get a water taxi to the airport - cost us 130 euros for the taxi out. Hotel breakfast was adequate. Very busy and small dining area. Staff for breakfast was not too helpful. St. Marks was flooding the nights we were there and we were a little nervous about making the trek through the square with our luggage, but the water subsided prior to our having to leave. All in all this hotel was very nice, clean and convenient. Would recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “San Marco Palace”
Reviews.Author: Hamilton338
Reviews.Content: The San Marco Palace Suites are well located just a minute of so walk from St Marks Square. We found the hotel using the advice from a previous posting on Tripadvisor â€“ from the Sam Marco water bus stop walk straight across Saint Marks square with St Marks church to your right and the campanile on your left until you reach the North side, then walk left until you see the restaurant Quadri, go down the alley next to the restaurant and cross the small bridge, turn right immediately and the entrance to the hotel is at the end of the short path next to the canal. The hotel consists of suites that are like small flats rather than the usual hotel rooms. I had the cheapest suite and it was very spacious for Venice accommodation. Be aware that although the suites have a small kitchen area with microwave, refrigerator and hotplate there is no cutlery, no kettle and no cooking pans â€“ you would have to bring them yourself if you wanted to self cater. The good points are that the rooms are clean and comfortable and spacious. The hotel is also surprisingly quiet and private for such a central location. The bad points are that the breakfast is not as good as at another Venice hotel I stayed at â€“ it is only a limited buffet with a coffee machine rather than the normal delicious Italian coffee, also at busy breakfast times the staff seemed to struggle to replenish the food as it was eaten. Staff were polite but were not as helpful or as knowledgeable as at other hotels. The San Marco Suites seems to fall between being serviced flats and a hotel â€“ its not one or the other. The central location and the spacious suites however could make it a good choice for families or groups.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Family”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoFamilyof5
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research on this hotel before we booked it. . . .and based on the many favorable reviews of families that stayed here we booked it and was not disappointed. We are a family of 5. Although anything in Venice can be hard to find, we found the San Marco Palace with ease. In fact it has to be one of the easier ones (go to San Marco Square via the Water Bus Line #1, walk to the North Side of the square and find the Quadry Restaurant, walk through the passage way next to it, go over the bridge and take the first right (at the end of the bridge) and walk next to the canal - once you get to a dead end - you're there). The hotel was clean, the staff was helpful, very fluent in English, and the rooms were surprisingly large. I know some people had issues with hot water and electricity - we didn't at all. Some others were concerned about the noise since the hotel is so close to the Square. We had no issues with noise and we even stayed there over New Year's. The only advice we would give you is to either go to Murano Island for the glass tour on your own dime or be prepared to buy some glass from the Glass Company the Hotel takes you to. We never got to see the Island since we were literally trapped at the glass factory. We tried to get out of the factory to tour the island but couldn't find our way out. The door was the dock. Although we were not pressured to buy their glass, they definitely wanted us to buy. Those that did got a water taxi back quickly. Those that didn't (us) waited about an hour and had to ask twice. We had a hard time spending $170 Euro for a 2 inch by 2 inch plate. Overall this was a great hotel for us. We hope you find our review as usefull as the ones we relied on to make our Venice trip a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: parentchildNy
Reviews.Content: Our family of six recently stayed at the San Marco Palace Suites in Venice. We chose San Marco because of the generous reviews of other large families who expressed satisfaction with the location and amenities of this hotel. Unfortunately, our experience did not match those of the previous reviewers. We initially booked for five people but changed our booking several weeks prior to arrival to six people. We confirmed the booking immediately prior to leaving the States but did not bring a hard copy of that email with us. That may have been our undoing. Upon arrival, we were greeted very lukewarmly by the reception desk and immediately told that they were not prepared for six of us. They claimed they did not have internet access so that I could not retrieve the email they'd sent me just days earlier that confirmed that we were reserved for six people. They eventually agreed that they could give us a room for six if we paid one hundred euros more each night. The suite they put us in had two bedrooms joined by a living space with a table and four chairs. One bedroom had a lovely king sized bed and a small balcony overlooking a canal. The other bedroom had lovely canal views, one single bed and a rollaway. Two more rollaways, one clearly the 100 euro a night one, were crammed into the living space. There was one bathroom for all six of us. Our request for a larger space and another bathroom was met with the comment that we were "lucky" to have the room we'd been given. This expensive, beautiful hotel provided no special amenities and none of the usual perks one finds in higher end hotels. And the staff, with only one exception, was either indifferent or openly rude. The price we paid for the San Marco is in no way commensurate with the level of attention and care we received. We do not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & service!”
Reviews.Author: goaliedad30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife & two teenage boys prior to our recent Mediterranean cruise. We were able to book a sizable suite for the four of us, which ended up being perfect. The location was outstanding, and the service was great. Breakfast was well-appointed, with lots of different choices among rolls, pastries, meats, cheeses and fruit. Since Lufthansa left our bags in Frankfurt, we didn't have to lug the bags TO the hotel, but did have to take them through Piazza San Marco to catch transportation to the cruise ship. Not really too bad a hike, given the nature of Venice; perhaps a 3 minute walk. Overall, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “2 very different hotels”
Reviews.Author: fitnessfan
Reviews.Content: Im lucky to have been to venice a few times and my second stay was in the torre d' orlogio which is a very posh hotel! The room was fantastic, huge and beautifully furnished. Again location is excellent literally round the back of san marco square.Im sure its a five star hotel thinking back as it was a couple of years ago i stayed there.....everything you would expect from a five star and the price will reflect that i remeber it was very expensive!! Much better value was the san marco palace even closer to san marks square if you can believe it you litterally walk out of the hotel and your there. That was an important consideration as on my last trip i took my mother who was worried about the amount of walking she would have to do so a central location was important and after all the research i did this was the most reasonably priced hotel at the nearest to san marco and proved great value for money. Not as swish and contempory as the first hotel but still nice rooms furnished well with great breakfasts. i also found it strange to have a kitchette but no pots or pans?? Some venice tips.... yes we did a gondala in the afternoon that time 80 euros but do ask first. We paid 100 the first time we went but that was at night. To the left of the basillica is a small concert hall you will see flyers everywhere for vivaldis four seasons which is lovely but even better was the second evening of songs from different operas which was absolutley magical and one of the highlights. Make sure you go to the top of the campinile the veiws are spectacular. I'd also reccomend going to burrano rather than murano all you will see on murano is the same glass wear your sick of looking at in venice by day four!! whereas burrano is so pretty as everyhouse is painted a different colour well worth a day trip There are some great resturants up by the opera house behind san marco expesive but beautiful food however If you go down the side of the clock tower and take the first right you should emmidiatley come to an italian resturant that does the best spagetti and meat balls in the whole of venice. And if your feeling extravagant order a glass of champange or two at the bar inside florians and drink it there while your served with canopies and that will be cheaper than ordering tea or coffee and sitting outside!! enjoy venice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location-Beware of Bellman”
Reviews.Author: Jerseynurs
Reviews.Content: Had a three stay @ the San Marco Suite located behind San Marco Square-- The suite consisted of Master bedroom, Living-dinning room-kitchenete and second bedroom- mini balcony @ Master bedroom- bathroom - with antique decorations all very well kept and clean- rooms have side-canal view- The only problem we encoutered was a bellman-concierge who is very rude and has no social skills- he tossed the room key onto my hand and walked away upon our arrival -Did not even gave us direction to get to our Suite- If you don't mind this type of incident the hotel is centrally located near best attractions in Venice-

Reviews.Title: “Torre Dell Orologio Suites were great!”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaTracy
Reviews.Content: San Marco Palace - The Torre Dell Orologio - has had very mixed reviews- We are used to staying in 4 & 5 star rating hotels- the European ratings and American ratings are a bit different. After some research and visiting with others we were prepared for smaller rooms & moderate service. With the mixed reviews we were very reluctant to begin our honeymoon trip with this hotel- but we were pleasantly surprised! The price was a very good value for the location, room size, continental breakfast & quality. We stayed 2 nights- the suite offered a kitchenette, sofa, table/chairs, 2 bathrooms & comfortable bed. This being our first trip to Italy and our honeymoon- I was hoping that everything would be as we expected! It was very delightful and we would stay again. The front entrance of the Torre was somewhat difficult to find- so try to have good directions. Arriving after dark could be a challenge! We were 23 meters from the clock tower of San Marco- it was a fabulous location. The hotel was quiet and the breakfast dining area- was a maze to get to- but very nice with granolas, fruit, danishes, meat and cheese tray, juices, excellent coffee, hot teas, and other goodies. The hotel staff was fine at check in and check out-which were some of the mixed reviews- but we had no issues. We were looking for a quiet place, good location, comfortable beds, spacious room, a decent breakfast, clean & updated hotel and the Torre Dell Orlogio did deliver! 2 days in Venice was plenty- The godola ride was a little pricey-but it is Venice! you should spend the money and enjoy it! The glassware was nice - but pricey- all of the little shops were fun to browse through. We had okay meals- so I would suggest getting suggestions and mapping out the locations before your arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AnAussieFamily
Reviews.Content: We'll definitely go back here â€“ itâ€™s not cheap, but well worth it for the central location and spaciousness. We loved it so much we tried to extend our stay there while there, but couldn't get later flights out. Our family of 4 (7y/o & 10y/o) stayed here for 4 nights even though we had read some negative reviews. Our experience was very positive. The room was spacious, with two bedrooms and a living/kitchen - all spotlessly clean and modern. Both bedrooms looked out over a small canal (one was actually built over the canal) where it was fascinating to watch gondola owners put away their boats for the night. The staff were friendly, helpful and spoke good English. The included breakfast was fine, but don't expect an English or America menu. There was no crockery or cutlery, so we purchased some from a local supermarket, and used the microwave to heat water for tea & coffee! Location: It was not difficult to locate the hotel, but to help, here are some directions - from the Grand Canal walk through Piazza San Marco to mid way along the northern section where you'll find an alley going north by shop number 119. Set above head height on the wall of the alley are two signs - a white one - SOTOPORTEGO DEI DAI and yellow one - PER RIALTO FERROVIA - P. LE ROMA. Walk along that alley a short distance and over the bridge crossing the Rio del Procurate canal. Immediately after you get over the bridge turn right and you walk along side the canal for a few metres to the hotel entrance. The only difficult bit is carrying cases up and down the approximately eight steps each side of the small bridge, but at least they are the only steps and it is not far to walk from the San Marco Vaporetti stop. Other advice: The three day Vaporetti pass was by far the most economical and effective way to get around. We took a water taxi back to the airport at the end which was expensive (90E) but great fun and well worth it for a grand and easy exit from Venice. Food everywhere was excellent - we really enjoyed Vino Vino (located on the corner of Calle della Vestr and Rio della Veste) - good food, simple pasta the kids liked and very reasonably priced; but the options for great food and wine and icecreams for the kids were endless. The Lido was dirty last time we were there, but fine this time and a highlight for the kids was hiring a 4 wheeled 4 person bike in Gran Viale Santa Maria Elisabetta, to travel in to the beach. We took a Gondola ride during the day and another one in the evening - the latter was much better, cooler and you avoid the very crowded day time Gondola traffic. Expect to pay up to 100E but avoid the evening surcharge by starting before 7pm. We paid 80E, while the Americans before us on the same boat paid 100E! Do some research about current prices and times and be clear about what youâ€™ll pay or the Gondola operator will try for whatever he can get!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious & Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: leopold25
Reviews.Content: We visited venice at half term with our 8 year old. We arrived in the dark by water taxi dropping us as close as possible - but then we got lost! The location is amazing - just behind St Marks Square. it is really easy to get around with the water bus stop very close and we walked for hours. Hotel suite was on 4th floor - two bedrooms, mini kitchen in a cupboard with fridge, two rings and a microwave (no kettle) - we didn't use it at all but a cup of coffee would have been nice. Good breakfast , pleasant staff - a nice atmosphere. Lots of families - as good sized accommodation and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, Great price”
Reviews.Author: mjack1409
Reviews.Content: We had a large suite on the 5th floor with a sitting room, bedroom and small kitchen. The location is very close the St. Marks and the staff was very helpful in arranging resturant reservations and advice on where to go. We would be happy to stay there again Beverly and Mike Jackson, Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: TravlChick
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with family in June. We booked 3 rooms - one for my family (2 adults, 2 teenagers), one for my elderly mother, and one for my brother's family (2 adults, 2 kids under 12). The "suites" are spacious although not as big as something like a US Embassy Suites. They include a good sized bedroom, a living room with foldout couch/cot, and a full bathroom. They also have a cooktop and refrigerator, although the cooktop is not really functional since they don't include pots or pans or plates. The refrigerator came in handy for drinks and leftovers. The breakfast is quite good and is included in rate - good assortment of meats and cheeses, cereals, fruits, breads, etc. The location can't be beat - just off of Saint Mark's square - but it is still quiet and is located at the end of a tiny canal. It is a little tricky to find the hotel the first time so be sure to get the map off of their internet site. It is important to know that the tiny canal it is located on is too small for water taxis to enter. So, water taxis can only bring you to the main water taxi park (near the vaporetto stop) at St. Mark's square. You then have to walk across the square (all the way across) and through one of the walkways, up and down steps (to go over the small canal) and then a few more steps to the hotel. This isn't a big deal if you are walking only, but if you are carrying luggage you need to be prepared for this, as we weren't. I would not recommend that an elderly person try to do this and roll luggage unless they are fit. Also, there is one small elevator that is often slow. We stayed on the very top floor (5 stories) and ended up walking up and down the steps for the three days we were there. Not a huge hassle but something you should be aware of.

Reviews.Title: “Now you have it...now you don't”
Reviews.Author: Retired05
Reviews.Content: Save aggravation and your money. After my friends and I booked this luxury hotel I saw reviews where they moved people to other hotels. Well they did it to us. They moved us across the street to their associate motel, which by their own brochure, was two levels lower in class. When I questioned the people at the desk they talk to me like I didnâ€™t know what I was talking about and I was stupid. I am a seasoned traveler, the motel was satisfactory, not the luxury I paid for, so I decided to enjoy Venice and deal with this when I get home. For over a month my travel company has been trying to get the manager to respond for a refund in the difference in price between the luxury price I paid and the motel price I should be charged. He is never available and doesnâ€™t return calls. Venice is wonderful. Read reviews before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great suites! Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: mikemtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 nights in july with 2 kids (3 & 10). Initially when we got there we were concerned as the check-in counter is small and uninspiring. But they brought us to our room and it was beautiful (they have 3 buildings behind San Marco Square and we were in the Torre del orologio - Tower of the clock). We had a 2 bedroom unit with a nice large living room with very large sofa bed, a nice kitchen and 2 bathrooms. Extremely clean, comfortable, excellent windows (no noise from outside), great drapes and good air conditioning. Breakfast was nice and had good choices (all cold). The location is amazing you are 30 seconds (50 feet) from San MArco Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkFamily5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our vacation and had to write a review. I did a lot of research for a place to stay one night in Venice. Since most hotels don't allow 5 people in one room and since we are a 5 person family, I had to find hotel that would accommodate us. Well, after reading ALOT of reviews on the San Marco Palace, I was a little nervous to book this but the location sounded perfect and they had a family suite. We had the directions to the hotel from the water stop that were posted from another reviewer and they were right on... but we still got a little lost but quickly righted ourselves and found it. It was in a perfect location right behind St. Marks Square. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful (no rude people on our visit). We had the family suite on the top floor and it was really nice. A HUGE balcony with a view of the bell tower and tops of roofs. Not the most spectacular but really a bonus to have the balcony. The room was neat and efficient and the bathroom was clean and the water was fine. The beds were a little hard and small, but when you are tired from running around Venice all day, it's all good! The room is a little worn but really very acceptable. We didn't have breakfast there so I can't comment. There are too many great places to eat at so we just went out and found somewhere to grab a quick bite. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay. Just a comment on the Murano tour that came with our room...There was no push for the tour from the hotel staff, just a comment when we checked in. When we came back into the hotel at night, we decided to take the free tour (private water taxi & tour) to Murano. The hotel manager on duty that night suggested that we go over after lunch, around 1:30 the next day. We did that and it was fantastic! We had our own private tour because there were no other people in the glass factory at that time. In any event we watched them blow glass and then we walked around the showroom (no obligation or push to buy). The men blowing the glass were so talented. It was facinating to watch. All in all, it was a great stay and I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “30 seconds to San Marco Square”
Reviews.Author: Aussie101
Reviews.Content: Our travel party included 2 adults and 3 children and finding a place for us to all stay together (vs separate rooms) was a challenge in Venice. The accomodation was in suites with a separate bedroom and then a lounge which could easily take 3 single beds. We had a veranda with views and the quality of fitout was excellent. In fact, it was probably the best we stayed in. The only negatives to the property were the price (but hey it is Venice and I don't think you could do better) and the staff. On our 4 week holiday we only encountered one set of hotel staff that displayed no interest or energy in helping guests and this was it (my husband said they reminded him of Basil Fawlty from Fawlty Towers). And breakfast was below average (stale, poor quality food, and limited choice). But if want to see Venice, need Suite type accomodation only 30 seconds to San Marco Sqaure this place is a good choice and I do wonder if there would be better out there. We have no regrets about the choice but be aware it is not perfect espeically for the price.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: louise12399
Reviews.Content: just returned from a three night stay at san marco palace. getting there from the airport was pretty easy, ticket booths in arrivals hall, ticket cost 12 euros each, takes a good five minutes to get to water bus station if you walk fast. boats were spacious and staff friendly, but journey takes 60 to 70 minutes to reach san marco as there are many stops along the way. once we reached san marco we had printed out the previous travellers review as he had good instructions on how to find the hotel, thanks for that as they were spot on. on booking this hotel it was advertised as having a balcony but thats not the reality, when we got ther we realised that the rooms with balconies were family rooms on the top floor so were dissapointed by this. staff were all friendly and polite and the room was spacious and clean but the individual climate control you are promised did not work, looked like you needed a key for it! cleaner came every day and done a good job, had one diet coke and one white wine out of minibar and were charged 10 euros, which is okay by venice standards. found the local pub that the gondoliers drink in and had a ball, but be warned it costs more to drink if you sit down! by the end of the night we were like old friends with staff and had complimentary cheese and meat boards sent over and drinks got larger as the night wore on. only negative that i can think of on this trip was the hotels idea of breakfast, not really much choice, only full fat milk and the cereal was hard, would reccomend giving it a miss. had a great time in venice for our anniversary and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Suites a good deal”
Reviews.Author: weston43
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day stay @ San Marco Palace suites and enjoyed the location and the room we had. The breakfast was ok, everyone in our party was happy with the choice and quantity. Our room and bathroom were quite clean. I agree w/ other posts the bed and pillows were hard, but we slept anyway we were exhausted from heat, humidity, and travel. The location was great and our overall experience was very good. We did get conflicting answers on getting to the airport from the day and night staff. We found the night staff more willing to help and more pleasant overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!! Great Hotel easy to get to”
Reviews.Author: Wali
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in the San Marco palace for 7 days, and enjoyed a generally great holiday here, with San Marco sq. literally a stine throw away. Rialto bridge is a 5 minute walk if you know your way. To actually reach the hotel is simplest from San Marco. If you face the basilica and look to your left, walk under the canope and half way down there is an alleyway : Sotoportego dei dai - take this, and after the small canal turn right, and the reception is at the corner at the end. After a hard days sightseeing, our suite's air conditioning cooled us down perfectly. Breakfast was ok but not so plentiful, and food can become cold at the end of the service. One problem that tarnished the hotel was on our second day where we encountered a leak in the roof above the main door. after enquiring to the staff, nothing was done apart from placing a bucket under the door, and that was under the cleaner's accord. In my opinion the staff are good but there arew a few sour grapes in the bunch - watch out.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience was so, so”
Reviews.Author: SteveEagar
Reviews.Content: There are positives and negatives about this hotel. With the number of hotels in the city of Venice, I would think you could find one that might work out better for you. We stayed here because we were able to secure a family suite that handled my family of five, so that was definitely a positive. The suite was large, and the balcony was huge, with a wonderful view. We also enjoyed the location. It really is just off the square, so if you forget something or need to drop something off, even to just run up to use the bathroom, it is convenient. The room configuration was one bedroom with a double bed, one with two twins, and then a sofa bed in the living room. The beds were VERY firm and not very comfortable. I had read here on trip advisor about a surly bellman and boy did we run into him. A real jerk. Right after checking in, he had our key and was to lead us to our room on the fourth floor. When we decided to try to make his job easier, (there were FIVE of us) and carry up our own bags... he stopped, didn't say a word, held out the room key, dropped it in my wife's hand and turned and walked away without a word. No instruction on how to find the room, how the key worked, anything. I'm not sure if he thought since he wouldn't carry the bags he wouldn't get a tip and therefore, SEE YA!!! But, he was a jackass. It's funny how an experience like that kind of sours you on the whole experience. This is the reason I love trip advisor. It gives me a voice. What would this guy or the operator care about me if I have a bad experience, hey, they got paid. But now we can all force them to be better by honestly revealing behavior. So, anyway, the experiences with some of the individuals with San Marco Palace Suites was... I guess a bit flat. But the location was great, the city is fabulous, and the view from our balcony was wonderful. Yes, it seems the Tower and church bells ring all the time, but it wasn't a big deal. Overall, Venice was TEEMING with people, a lot of tourists in June. But we still had a really good time. In my opinon the city and it's beauty make any visit enjoyable. A fantastic hotel would have made things even better, this wasn't that. But we worked around it. I would recommend you stay somewhere else. If you can't find another place, just know going in it won't be perfect and you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster at the Suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, to start off with, its not 4 stars! I can get over that, the room was big, although not the cleanest. Or maybe its just extra dusty in Venice? The location is great, only a few steps from the Square, but the issues you have dragging your suitcases through Venice trying to find the place makes you wish you thought twice about your booking. There IS a dock right outside the hotel yet no boat ever seems to pass? The staff was just evil. The bellhop walked out on us as we dug for Euros to tip him...the desk closes at 10 pm and reopens at 7 am...the people at the main desk insisted the only way to get to the airport at 6am was to take a private taxi (110 euros) while we ended up taking the airport taxi (10 euros but took a bit longer). The "beds" are nothing more then cots with really ugly and old sheets/covers. While the rooms accomodate up to 6 people, the water heater accomodates 1 shower at best. For anyone who cares...the minibar was lackluster and the rooms reminded me of apartments in NYC built in the 1970s..green tile and bad lighting..stained bathtub! If you decide to stay there,I wish you the best! Overall, I will never ever go back to this hotel. The staff more then anything was a huge turn off. We felt uncomfortable with anything that they told us and resorted to asking the locals who worked at the restaurants we ate at. For the amount of money spent, we could have stayed at a REAL 4-star hotel right in The Square. The only positives of this hotel: location and accomodates a group of up to 6 (one big bed in the bedroom, 2 cots and a stained sofabed).

Reviews.Title: “Suite wa sour”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 1.A giraffe may get a view of the bell tower, we could not. 2.Cable TV is CNN & BBC Worldservice, everything else is local/national italian. 3.Eat and drink what you like from the minibar, lacklustre service to guests also applies to their employers. 4.4 stars it is not, if you are staying with kids the rooms are roomy but for the price you could do better with 2 rooms at a real 4 star. 5.They won't order you a water taxi to the hotel even though there is a dock attached. You are left to dragging your cases across the square to the quayside. 6.They have figured out a way of you not being able to charge anything, even with a euro plug, as they have a special 2 pin to 3 pin adaptor on all of their in-room appliances. 7.Donâ€™t expect more than one bath per day, even if there are 4 of you. 8.You won't have to tip anyone as they won't speak to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Situated right behind St Marks Sq, the rooms were very comfortable and clean and being so close to everything it was handy if you wanted to pop back and freshen up. The balcony of our hotel was enormous with a fantastic view of the Campanille. Be warned the bells of Venice ring throughout the night as well as during the day, so the Campanille being so close will wake you. We found that after only a couple of days we began to sleep through the bells. The staff where very efficient and helpful and the complimentary taxi ride out to Murano island was handy. In comparison to some of the four star hotels I have stayed in throughout the world, the breakfast was more than disappointing, but friends tell me that this is a common problem in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “It could be beautiful, but beware-----”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, however, you don't get what you booked. They tried to put us in a hotel "around the corner". which happened to be around the corner, down the block, in an alleyway with poor lighting and an elevator that did not work. Not at all what is pictured, even with our reservations confirmed. Be persistent. We eventually ended up in the rooms that are pictured, but with alot of arguing, packing and moving, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: WendyWorcs
Reviews.Content: Wonderful position. Less than 100 paces from St Mark's Square. Entrance is a bit hidden, so as you come from the square, go over the canal bridge & turn immediately right, & the door is hidden at the end on the left. We found the staff helpful & they did not push any trips. Breakfast perfectly OK & as we were always ready to go early we found no problems with food running out. Rooms very spacious. having read that there was no equipment with the room, we did take our kettle (can't do without that waking up cup of tea). Already talking about going back as we loved Venice so much & wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: San Marco Palace Suites
HotelInfo.Address: Ponte dei Dai 875 | Piazza San Marco, 30124 Venice, Italy
